tspan.tspan: FDA restricts participation of
women with child bearing potential
in early phase clinical studies.
NIH guidelines urging
the inclusion of women
in clinical research.
U.S. Governement Accountability
Office (GOA) reveals that NIH
guidelines are not followed.
FDA revokes earlier restrictions on the
participation of women with child bearing
potential in early phase clinical studies.
NIH policy requesting to account for
the possible role of sex as a biological
variable in vertebrate animal and
human studies.
NIH policy on reporting of cell
and
animal inclusion plans in
preclinical
experimental design.
GAO warns FDA for not monitoring sex
differences in research data effectively in
relation to drug safety and efficacy.
NIH Revitalization Act empowering the inclusion of
women and members of minorities in all research
involving human subjects.
FDA recommends that sponsors provide an
integrated summary of safety and effectiveness
and data analysis by gender, race and age.
FDA Safety and Innovation Act requiring the
accounting of trials by sex, race, and ethnicity.
